title: Sydney Drivers Left Stranded For Hours After M4 Tunnel Closes | 10 News
description: Commuters were effectively left stranded in the M4 tunnel for up to four hours today due to fears that concrete could have fallen onto passing cars. Emergency roadworks are needed with the issue discovered during an overnight closure between Haberfield and Homebush. title: Ex-Neighbours Actor Given Rare Offer By Magistrate Over Nazi Salute Charge | 10 News
description: A magistrate has ordered former Neighbours star Damien Richardson to contact Australia's Jewish community for advice on how he should be punished for performing the Nazi salute. The unusual legal move comes a year after Richardson made the gesture at a meeting of far-right extremists. title: Viral Aussie Twin Sisters Campaign To Protect Birds From Construction Proposal | 10 News+
description: Paula and Bridgette Powers, affectionately known as ‘The Twinnies’ online, took the internet by storm earlier this year for their uncanny trait of speaking in exact unison. Now, the viral twin sisters from Queensland are using their fame to campaign against the proposed development of a music festival site on the Sunshine Coast. The construction would impact a green belt where some of the bird species from their sanctuary live. title: Under-16 Social Media Ban To Begin, Spotify Wrapped 2025, New Epstein Island Photos | 10 News+
description: Young Australian influencer Samuel Weidenhofer uses his platform to spread kindness and help others. Using the power of social media, he has raised over $2 million in a bid to help an 88-year-old American man retire from his supermarket job. Ed, who is a veteran who lost his wife and had his pension taken away, will be surprised by Samuel in Detroit with a retirement party on Friday.  As the countdown towards December 10 begins, when Australia’s landmark social media ban will come into effect, children under 16 are already being locked out of their accounts. A message has been appearing on Instagram, Facebook, and Threads, informing users they won’t be able to access the platform and that their profiles won’t be visible, until they turn 16. 10 News+ spoke to Sydney teenager, Noah Jones, who is behind a High Court challenge to stop the government’s new laws. He says predators and explicit content will still exist online and that kids will find ways to bypass the ban, making it more dangerous.  Paula and Bridgette Powers, affectionately known as ‘The Twinnies’ online, took the internet by storm earlier this year for their uncanny trait of speaking in exact unison. Now, the viral twin sisters from Queensland are using their fame to campaign against the proposed development of a music festival site on the Sunshine Coast. The construction would impact a green belt where some of the bird species from their sanctuary live.  United States House Democrats have released photos and videos of late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein’s private Caribbean island. The new vision shows bedrooms, offices, and even a room with a dentist chair. Other photos featuring a blackboard and a landline phone have some names redacted.
